newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Rieter sees no divestment of textiles.
newsitem.headline: Rieter sees no divestment of textiles.

text.p: Chief executive Kurt Feller of Rieter Holding AG said on Monday the manufacturer was not interested in divesting its traditional but volatile textile division after expanding into automobile equipment.

Feller told reporters he could not imagine selling off Rieter textiles, made up of spinning systems and chemical fibres, in favour of concentrating on a growing business in insulation coverings for cars and trucks.
"Under no circumstances would we divest from the textiles business," Keller told reporters after a company presentation to the Swiss-American Chamber of Commerce.
Strong cyclical swings in world textile business have prompted Rieter to expand in the steadier automobile business.

Acquiring major U.S. auto supplier Globe Industries Inc in mid-1995 helped boost Rieter sales last year by 25 percent to 2.008 billion Swiss francs, although it said last week restructuring charges were expected to push net profit slighlty below 1995's 56.2 million Swiss francs.
Feller said sales and profitibility could be improved at textiles along with growing the auto business.
"It would also be wrong to get rid of textiles because much of our know-how for the auto business comes from our traditional know-how," Feller added.
Rieter auto products use textiles and fibres to make heat and sound insulation as well as interior linings for cars and trucks.
